description: Check if a private IP address is available for use within a virtual network.

commands.name: az network vnet check-ip-address
commands.summary: Check if a private IP address is available for use within a virtual network.
examples: az network vnet check-ip-address -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnet --ip-address 10.0.0.4

commands.name: az network vnet create
commands.syntax:
az network vnet create --name
                       --resource-group
                       [--address-prefixes]
                       [--bgp-community]
                       [--ddos-protection {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--ddos-protection-plan]
                       [--dns-servers]
                       [--edge-zone]
                       [--enable-encryption {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--encryption-enforcement-policy {AllowUnencrypted, DropUnencrypted}]
                       [--flowtimeout]
                       [--ipam-allocations]
                       [--location]
                       [--network-security-group]
                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--pe-vnet-policies {Basic, Disabled}]
                       [--subnet-name]
                       [--subnet-prefixes]
                       [--subnets]
                       [--tags]
                       [--vm-protection {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network vnet create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVnet --address-prefix 10.0.0.0/16 --subnet-name MySubnet --subnet-prefixes 10.0.0.0/24
az network vnet create --address-prefixes 10.0.0.0/16 --name MyVirtualNetwork --resource-group MyResourceGroup --subnet-name MyAseSubnet --subnet-prefixes 10.0.0.0/24
az network vnet create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVNet --ipam-allocations [0].number-of-ip-addresses=100 [0].id=ipam-pool-resource-id

commands.name: az network vnet delete
commands.syntax:
az network vnet delete [--ids]
                       [--name]
                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--resource-group]
                       [--subscription]
examples: az network vnet delete -g MyResourceGroup -n myVNet

commands.name: az network vnet list-available-ips
commands.summary: List some available ips in the vnet.
examples: az network vnet list-available-ips -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVNet

commands.name: az network vnet list-endpoint-services
commands.summary: List which services support VNet service tunneling in a given region.
examples: az network vnet list-endpoint-services -l westus -o table

commands.name: az network vnet show
commands.summary: Get the details of a virtual network.
examples: az network vnet show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVNet

commands.name: az network vnet update
commands.syntax:
az network vnet update [--add]
                       [--address-prefixes]
                       [--bgp-community]
                       [--ddos-protection {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--ddos-protection-plan]
                       [--dns-servers]
                       [--enable-encryption {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--encryption-enforcement-policy {AllowUnencrypted, DropUnencrypted}]
                       [--flowtimeout]
                       [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--ids]
                       [--ipam-allocations]
                       [--name]
                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                       [--pe-vnet-policies {Basic, Disabled}]
                       [--remove]
                       [--resource-group]
                       [--set]
                       [--subscription]
                       [--vm-protection {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network vnet update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVNet --dns-servers 10.2.0.8
az network vnet update --address-prefixes 40.1.0.0/24 --name MyVNet --resource-group MyResourceGroup
az network vnet update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVNet --dns-servers null

commands.name: az network vnet wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
